intro: Turraea socotrana, commonly known as Socotra's turraea, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its morphology includes a woody stem with thick, leathery foliage that helps reduce water loss. Turraea socotrana is also notable for its role in the local ecosystem and its potential medicinal properties.
